newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine unions plan reaction to labor reforms.
newsitem.headline: Argentine unions plan reaction to labor reforms.

text.p: The leadership of Argentina's main CGT union federation met Friday to discuss how to react to President Carlos Menem's decision to sign three decrees on labor market reforms.
CGT leaders started their meeting at 1830 local time (2130 GMT) to ponder how to react to the decrees.
Late Wednesday Menem decided to end weeks of negotiations with the unions and bypass reluctant lawmakers by introducing the first labor reforms by decree.
Unions staged a 36-hour general strike in September in opposition to the labor market reforms and other government measures.
